intro: Hieracium porrectum subsp. macroporrectum, commonly known as the large-rayed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring yellow flowers with large, showy ray florets. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often reddish in color. This subspecies is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
